event.speaker: Keynotes by Andrey Breslav & Erik Meijer
event.title: Kotlin Conference
event.description: Two days of content from Kotlin creators and community members

event.speaker: Shoichi Matsuda
event.title: 第3回Kotlin勉強会 ＠Sansan
event.subject: Kotlinでテストコードを書く
event.description: Kotlin

event.speaker: Taro Nagasawa
event.title: 第3回Kotlin勉強会 ＠Sansan
event.subject: KotlinのClass Delegationおさらい
event.description: Kotlin

event.speaker: Josh Rebootd
event.title: PHX Android/GDGPhoenix
event.subject: PHX Android: Kotlin Intro for Beginners by a Beginner
event.description: Josh is going to do an introduction into Kotlin. What is Kotlin? What benefits does it offer? What can it do to make your job better? All these questions answered, and pizza.

event.speaker: Jan Ahrens
event.title: Java User Group Hamburg
event.subject: JVM-based microservices: Tails from 1,5 years of evolution with Java 8, Kotlin a
event.description:
A microservice based architecture, Amazon Web Services and Java 8: Those were the basic building blocks that the moovel team picked when they started the development of their mobility platform on a green field.

After 1,5 years of time the landscape has changed quite a bit. They tried different approaches, failed with some and learned a lot. At the beginning they started by using Spring Boot with Java 8 by the book. Later on they started to use more and more functional programming patterns, by utilizing the built in Java 8 features and the Javaslang library. As experiments some microservices were implemented with the help of Kotlin and Scala.

event.speaker: Semih Bozdemir
event.title: Java User Group Hamburg
event.subject: Kotlin for Android
event.description: Kotlin is very popular in Android Community recently. What features does Kotlin bring to Android world? Why should we try Kotlin? You will have a chance to see simple Kotlin usage for Android in this session.

event.speaker: Hiromitsu Shinohara
event.title: potatotips #39 (iOS/Android開発Tips共有会)
event.subject: Android Javaの既存アプリをKotlin × DataBindingで書き換えている話 / Kotlin with DataBinding
event.description: Please, find more details at the link (in japanese) https://potatotips.connpass.com/event/51176/

event.speaker: Rémi Pradal
event.title: Android Makers Paris 2017
event.subject: Kotlin in the real world. What you should be aware of before starting a Kotlin project
event.description: Kotlin is now recognized as a powerful and viable alternative to Java for Android development. Many are the articles which focus on the different assets of this language. In this talk, I will highlight the different tools and behaviors which are still missing in Kotlin and might be a handicap for you if you decide to migrate to this language.

event.speaker: @jumperson
event.title: 第3回Kotlin勉強会 ＠Sansan
event.subject: Kotlin + DataBinding を使った RecyclerView の実装

event.speaker: Will Madison
event.title: Go User Group Atlanta
event.subject: Kotlin for Gophers
event.description: Kotlin for Gophers. An introduction to Kotlin

event.speaker: Kai Koenig
event.title: Droidcon Vietnam
event.subject: 2017: Kotlin - how more then ever!
event.description:
It's 2017. Kotlin, a great language for the JVM, has been around for more than 6 years now and has changed the way a lot of developers look at the features and evolutionary progress of Java. Kotlin has become a very popular alternative to Java for Android developers and with Kotlin 1.1 being on its way, thing are going to become more exciting.

This talk will start with a brief introduction into Kotlin and its core language features. After this brief foray into concepts like Kotlin's immutable variables, null behaviour and other smarts like the syntactic sugar it provides for dealing with types and properties we'll have a look into what in store for Android developers and into new features in Kotlin 1.1, such as Kotlin Coroutines, Jack support for Android and lots of improvements to the standard library.

event.speaker: Volkmar Vogel
event.title: Kotlin User Group Cologne
event.subject: Kotlin Stammtisch
event.description:
Hallo,

beim nächsten Meetup wollen wir uns in einem Brauhaus/Bar treffen und einen gemütlichen Abend miteinander verbringen.

Die genaue Lokalität steht nun fest. Wir treffen uns im Tresörchen auf der Severinsstraße. Dort ist eine Kegelbahn und einiges an Kölsch für uns reserviert. Bis dahin sagen wir: "happy coding" :)

event.speaker: Braun Márton
event.title: Google I/O Extended 2017 Budapest
event.subject: Ízelítő a Kotlin nyelvű Android fejlesztésből

event.speaker: Ian Thomas
event.title: Central Florida Android Developers Group
event.subject: Kotlin in Production
event.description: I told you all to switch to Kotlin and you still have not so I'm back again to talk about it.

event.speaker: Piotr Kubowicz
event.title: Polish Java User Group
event.subject: Scala i Kotlin plus Java - ukryte tarapaty, czyli czego ci tutorial nie powie
event.description: Scala i Kotlin są prezentowane jako lepsze zamienniki Javy, mające pozwolić pisać bezpieczniejszy i bardziej zwięzły kod. Są to piękne wizje, co jednak faktycznie stanie się w sytuacji, gdy zespół rozwijający produkt w “starym” języku będzie miał dostarczać biblioteki zespołowi, który postanowił przejść na “nowocześniejsze rozwiązanie” - albo vice versa? Jak w praktyce wygląda deklarowana przez obydwu konkurentów Javy “pełna kompatybilność”?

event.speaker: Arnaud GIULIANI
event.title: Android Rennes
event.subject: Présentation d'intro à Kotlin
event.description: Présentation de découverte du langage, qui reprend certains aspects de groovy ou scala, et qui est très proche de swift dans la syntaxe et les concepts. Nous verrons comment Kotlin boost la productivité du développement d’applications Android et pourquoi vous ne pourrez plus vous en passer ;)

event.speaker: Enrique López Mañas
event.title: Kotlin User Group Munich - KUG Munich
event.subject: Anko for UI
event.description: Introduction on how to use Anko to create interfaces in Kotlin

event.speaker: Ruslan Zaharov
event.title: Kotlin London
event.subject: Safe code with Kotlin
event.description: We love Java because of it's mature ecosystem, strong typing system, and large community. From the first lines of code we learnt how to deal with workaround for Java code and still use them. What if we can be even more productive and write safer code? In this talk you'll see why typical java developers make a lot of safety compromises and how to make code safer in everyday tasks using Kotlin by employing it's typesystem and optional types. Even more: you'll remove good part of unit tests.

event.speaker: Sébastien Deleuze
event.title: Spring I/O 2017
event.subject: Functional web applications with Spring and Kotlin
event.description: Based on a concrete feedback about building a [conference website](https://github.com/mix-it/mixit/), I will show Spring Framework 5.0 in action with its [dedicated Kotlin support](https://spring.io/blog/2017/01/04/introducing-kotlin-support-in-spring-framework-5-0) and its new functional web and bean registration APIs.

event.speaker: Tomasz Kucharzyk
event.title: Lublin Java User Group
event.subject: Kotlin - Why should I care
event.description: Prezentacja będzie dotyczyła Kotlina - nowego języka programowania dla JVM (i nie tylko). Opowiem wam czym jest Kotlin, co dobrego może wnieść do waszego kodu i dlaczego jest taki fajny. Poznamy podstawy składni i zobaczymy wiele przykładów w których Kotlin może zabłysnąć na tle Javy. Opowiem również o wadach Kotlina i o tym jak można sobie z nimi radzić

event.speaker: Marko Arsić
event.title: Kotlin User Group Serbia
event.subject: Kotlin - What, Why, Where and How?
event.description: This is first Kotlin meetup in Belgrade, capital of Serbia. Speaker Marko Arsić will introduce Kotlin programming language to Belgrade's IT community and present benefits of using Kotlin in every day projects.

event.speaker: Konrad Krakowiak
event.title: DevCrowd
event.subject: Kotlin dla programisty JAVA
event.description: Kotlin jest nową alternatywą wśród języków pochodnych od języka JAVA, który dotychczas zdobył największe zainteresowanie. Prezentacja pokazuje jak w łatwy i bezbolesny sposób przejść z programowania w języku JAVA na programowanie w języku Kotlin. Opisuje dobre praktyki jakie należy stosować w języku Kotlin oraz odkrywa zalety tego języka.

event.speaker: Breandan Considine
event.title: Great Indian Developer Summit
event.subject: Building Developer Tools with Kotlin and Gradle
event.description: Kotlin is a new JVM language that offers increased null- and type-safety, support for building custom DSLs, and many functional idioms from Scala and Groovy. But one of the main advantages of using Kotlin is its tooling support. Now with Gradle, automating complex builds is now possible in Kotlin, letting you write tools and build logic in the same language. In this session, I will demonstrate how I rebuilt and maintain AceJump, a popular plugin for the IntelliJ Platform SDK using Kotlin and Gradle. We will discuss strategies for converting your existing Java code to Kotlin, how to configure Gradle to use Kotlin build scripts, and a Gradle plugin for building the IDE. This session will also cover the IntelliJ Platform SDK, a set of APIs that lets you build smarter developer tools ontop of the same platform that powers IntelliJ IDEA and its cousins. Attendees should have some basic familiarity with either Kotlin or Gradle in order to benefit from this session.

event.speaker: Svetlana Isakova
event.title: Android Devs Meetup
event.subject: Почему Kotlin?
event.description: Kotlin – альтернативный Java-язык программирования, который прекрасно совместим с Java-кодом и существующими Java-библиотеками. После релиза 1.0 Kotlin все чаще выбирают для решения задач, особенно в Android-сообществе. В докладе мы обсудим, какие особенности языка способствуют этому. Также поговорим о том, что важного появилось в релизе Kotlin 1.1.

event.speaker: Aleksandr Smirnov
event.title: Android Devs Meetup
event.subject: Kotlin Performance on Android
event.description: В докладе рассмотрим цену использования Kotlin в Runtime, обсудим варианты, как улучшить картину мира. Смотреть будем с точки зрения производительности, синхронно углубляясь в особенности Android, а также подумаем, как можно использовать получившийся байткод.

event.speaker: Dmitry Fisenko
event.title: Android Devs Meetup
event.subject: Функциональное программирование на Kotlin или за лямбду я замовлю слово
event.description: Дмитрий расскажет об основных принципах функционального программирования, случаях, когда лучше писать код в функциональном стиле, а также разберет инструменты Kotlin для функционального программировани

event.speaker: Jake Wharton
event.title: Devoxx US 2017
event.subject: 10 Kotlin Tricks in 10(ish) Minutes
event.description: Kotlin is new language growing in popularity as a complement to Java. Its major advantages and features compared to Java are immediately appealing. While it's quick to learn, it also has a lot of small and thoughtful parts which can be harder to discover. This short talk will cover 10 of my favorites with real-world examples. Attendees should come in having seen some Kotlin but looking to learn even more.

event.speaker: James Williams
event.title: Devoxx US 2017
event.subject: Kotlin, Android's Secret Weapon
event.description: Kotlin hit version 1.0 in early 2016 but it stands out as a concise and capable JVM language for making Android apps. In addition to being 100% Java compatible, Kotlin brings along null safety, data classes with automatic property accessors/modifiers, first-class functions, and lambdas to Android development. You can even use Kotlin for your Gradle build scripts.

event.speaker: Christina Lee and Huyen Tue Dao
event.title: DevFestDC 2017
event.subject: The Road to Kotlintown
event.description:
So you’ve probably heard of Kotlin, and you might even know that you can right-click any Java file and convert it automatically. Score! But wait, what are all these “!!” and why is the code littered with “?”. Sure, the code compiles, but how do you make the code not just compile but follow best practices? How nice does Kotlin play with the patterns, libraries, and frameworks that you might use every day?

In this talk we are going to discuss how you can get started in Kotlin converting current code and adding new code, current good practices and things to avoid, and specific challenges with the Android framework and open source libraries. Hopefully, you will leave this talk being able to get over those bumps and speed your way to Kotlintown.

event.speaker: Hadi Hariri
event.title: Open Sourse Convention
event.subject: Functional programming with Kotlin
event.description:
Hadi Hariri explains the basics of functional programming using Kotlin—where it fits in with the object orientation paradigm and how to use it in your everyday work. Along the way, Hadi covers important functional programming concepts, such as as lambdas, higher-order functions, currying, partial functions, memoization, and monads, and demonstrates how and where to apply functional patterns to cut down boilerplate code and keep it maintainable

While the workshop will use Kotlin, many of the concepts can be applied to other programming languages such as Java 8.

event.speaker: Emrah Bayraktaro­glu
event.title: Istanbul Coders
event.subject: Kotlin'e Örneklerle Giriş
event.description: PeakGames'te Java programlama dilini kullanarak gelistirdigimiz 5 tane basarili Android oyunumuz var. Bu oyunlara surekli yeni ozellikler ekliyoruz ve onumuzdeki 5 yil boyunca da bu oyunlara yeni ozellikler eklemeye devam edecegiz. Java programlama dilini ne kadar cok sevsek de, bu oyunlarimizin yeni ozelliklerini daha modern daha pragmatik ve Java 6 bytecode destekleyen bir JVM dili olan Kotlin ile gelistirme karari aldik. Bu sunumda Kotlin'in neden denemeye deger bir programlama dili oldugunu kod ornekleri ile gostermeye calisacagim.

event.speaker: Sinuhe Jaime
event.title: j4Guanatos
event.subject: Kotlin vs the Java 8 Features
event.description: Kotlin? Que es un Kotlin? En esta platica Sinuhe nos platicara como un lenguaje esta ganando terreno en el mundo de los lenguajes que corren sobre JVM y como muchos de sus features pueden llegar a reemplazar tu decision entre hacer upgrade a Java 8 o empezar con Kotlin

event.speaker: Francesco Vasco
event.title: JUG Milano
event.subject: Vert.x + Kotlin - fuga dal callback-hell
event.description: Vert.x è un framework di programmazione ad eventi particolarmente apprezzato per realizzare microservizi. L'utilizzo di Java per lo sviluppo asincrono rende spesso il codice ostico, vedremo quindi come programmare con Kotlin un multi-reattore senza finire all'inferno.

event.speaker: David Leppik
event.title: Twin Cities Kotlin User Group
event.subject: About functional programming and Kotlin
event.description: At the first meeting of the Twin Cities Kotlin User Group, David Leppik will deliver a talk on Functional Programming using Kotlin.

event.speaker: Alberto J Arias
event.title: Kotlin Toronto
event.subject: Introduction to coroutines in Kotlin
event.description: Introduction to coroutines in Kotlin. This presentation will be a high-level overview of coroutines and how they are implemented in Kotlin. We'll also look at code samples that use coroutines.

event.speaker: Jose Manuel
event.title: Betabeers Madrid - 74: Desarrollo Android con Kotlin, Shuttlecloud y Cocopifood
event.subject: The What Over The How (Another way on android development with Kotlin)
event.description: Para un mismo problema existe más de una solución aunque a veces existen barreras tecnicas que nos impiden abordarlas. Esta presentación pretende mostrar como, gracias a Kotlin, se nos abren otras opciones a la hora de abordar los problemas, centrandonos en nuestros problemas particulares y delegando a un segundo plano problemas recurrentes como la gestión de errores o la concurrencia.

event.speaker: Václav Souhrada
event.title: eMan Dev Meetup: Kotlin
event.subject: Intro o Kotlin CZ group
event.description: Kotlin je můj oblíbený programovací jazyk. Zkusil jsem ho asi před rokem a od té doby ho používám jak pro psaní Android aplikací, tak i pro vývoj hybridních mobilních aplikací jako náhražku za JavaScript a backend servery. Mile mě překvapilo, jak dokáže pročistit kód a urychlit proces vývoje.

event.speaker: Václav Souhrada
event.title: eMan Dev Meetup: Kotlin
event.subject: Kotlin & Top 10 věcí, které si zamilujete
event.description: Pokud ovládáte Javu, C#, JavaScript nebo Groovy, bude pro vás Kotlin hračka. Kotlin nově běží i mimo JVM a lze použít i tam, kde používáte JavaScript. Zaměřuje se na interoperabilitu, bezpečnost a jednoduchost. Je objektově orientovaným jazykem, i když využívá množství konceptů z funkčního programování.

event.speaker: Carlos Ballesteros
event.title: Geekshubs
event.subject: De Java a Kotlin: proyecto en producción
event.description: En la primera charla Carlos nos hablará de Java a Kotlin dando una introducción a Kotlin contando las diferencias con Java, explicando la migración y características destacables del lenguaje.

event.speaker: Miguel Ángel Ballesteros
event.title: Geekshubs
event.subject: De Java a Kotlin: proyecto en producción
event.description: Y en la segunda parte de la charla Miguel Ángel hablará de Kotlin en producción de la startup iAmarre. En este caso contará ¿Qué aporta Kotlin en un proyecto real?, ¿está preparado para ser usado en producción? La charla cuenta lo que supone usarlo en un proyecto real, llegando en los últimos meses a emplearlo full-stack (tanto en server como en cliente envolviendo a AngularJS).

event.speaker: Arnold Ádám
event.title: The Budapest New Technology Meetup Group
event.subject: Kotlin: gyors bevezető java fejlesztőknek
event.description: Az előadás bemutatja a Kotlin eredetét és célját, valamint gyakorlati peldákon keresztül szemlélteti, hogy milyen jótékony hatással rendelkezik a produktivitásra, illetve ötleteket ad arra, hogy nem-technikai embereket hogyan lehet meggyőzni az adoptacioról.

event.speaker: Nat Pryce
event.title: Kotlin London
event.subject: From Java8 to Kotlin
event.description: Converting Anura from Java 8 to Kotlin gradually, while continuing development of new features.

event.speaker: David Vávra
event.title: MobCon Europe
event.subject: From Firebase to UI with RxJava and Kotlin
event.description: Firebase Realtime Database is an awesome tool which solves offline and sync problems of your app. However, it requires flattening your data and your UI needs some bits from multiple Firebase paths. RxJava and Kotlin is ideal for this task. Online Rx examples are usually too simple – I will show you real-life examples which will help you understand the power of Rx.

event.speaker: Lieven Doclo
event.title: GeeCON 2017
event.subject: Implementing Clean Architecture using Kotlin
event.description: For those familiar with the teachings of Uncle Bob, Clean Architecture is no stranger. It's a set of architectural guidelines that provide a SOLID set of principes on which to base you architecture in order to have a clean, easy to understand and even easier to maintain foundation. This talk will show you how you can implement such an design, using Java, and will demonstrate the power of such a design. It will also show how you can be pragmatic in implementing Clean Architecture and what the possible implications can be when making pragmatic concessions.

event.speaker: James Avery & David Kilmer
event.title: Rochester Software Development Meetup
event.subject: How Kotlin Won Us Over
event.description: With 10 million lines of code in over 8000 OSS Github repositories, Kotlin has become a language worth looking into. In this talk James and David will give you a whirlwind tour of the most productivity-enhancing features of the language and show you how you can start to incorporate it painlessly into your own codebase. Along the way, you'll find out how our development team got addicted to Kotlin, and why it's now our default choice for new project.

event.speaker: Ítalo Maciel
event.title: GDG Recife
event.subject: #Hangout: Hello Kotlin! com Italo Marcel
event.description: Neste hangout você vai aprender por que e como você deve utilizar Kotlin nos seus projetos Android e aumentar sua produtividade.

event.speaker: Roland Berger
event.title: Java User Group Ch
event.subject: Einführung in Kotlin
event.description:
Kotlin soll zu hunderprozent kompatibel zu Java sein, läuft auf der JVM und bietet viele kleine, grosse, überraschende und erfrischende Erleichterungen gegenüber Java. Deswegen ist Kotlin für jeden Java Entwickler interessant.

Dass Kotlin ab der Version 1.1 auch zu JavaScript kompiliert werden kann, macht die Sprache nun auch für JavaScript Entwickler spannend.

Der Talk stellt die coolsten Kotlin Sprachfeatures vor.

Im zweiten Teil wird anhand eines REST Services auf Basis von Springboot gezeigt, dass die von JetBrains angepriesene 100% Kompatibilität zu Java kein Marketinggeschwafel ist.

Am Schluss gibt es ein Beispiel zur Kompilierung zu JavaScript.

event.speaker: Lucas Campos
event.title: GDG São Paulo
event.subject: Kotlin Interpolations
event.description: Kotlin

event.speaker: Grzegorz Dyrda
event.title: Bydgoszcz Java User Group
event.subject: Introduction to Kotlin
event.description: W swojej prezentacji postaram się Wam pokazać największe zalety świetnego (w mojej opinii) języka programowania, jakim jest Kotlin. Koduję w nim od ponad roku, i nie sposób przecenić jego czytelności, eleganckich rozwiązań największych problemów Javy, czy mnóstwa funkcji, których w Javie doczekamy się może za 5 lat… Jeśli dodać do tego fakt, że działa z Androidem out-of-the-box, oraz że zyskał oficjalne wsparcie w Springu 5.0, to robi się naprawdę ciekawie ;)

event.speaker: Singapore, Singapore
event.title: Grab Tech Thursdays
event.subject: Kotlin: A New Hope?
event.description: Introduction to Kotlin for Android developers

event.speaker: Bastien Ladron
event.title: Java User Group Luxembourg
event.subject: Kotlin
event.description: Kotlin is a language running on JVM and developed since 2010 by JetBrains (IntelliJ, Webstorm, ...) in order to replace their own Java stack. They currently use it in production for some of your favorite IDEs! This language takes advantage of the experience of many other languages (Java, Scala, C #, Groovy, ...), and is intended to be a natural transition for Java developers by taking advantage of our experience on the Java ecosystem, being compatible with legacy stacks, and without having inertia of backward-compatibility decades to ensure. This talk will be shared between slides and code, with examples of Kotlin syntax, interoperability with Java and integration into a Spring-boot stack.

event.speaker: Abdulla Obaid
event.title: Android Developers Amsterdam
event.subject: Kotlin Development
event.description:
Kotlin is a brand-new, open-source programming language made by the smart people at JetBrains, the creators of IntelliJ IDEA and Android Studio IDEs. Its been in development for around 6 years now. Kotlin introduces many improvements to Android development over Java including null-pointer safety, extension functions, clearer code structure, easier prototyping, and even 100% interoperability with Java.

In this talk, we will explore the following:

- Crash course on Kotlin

- Production-level Kotlin development

event.speaker: Alberto J Arias
event.title: Kotlin Toronto
event.subject: Functional programming with Kotlin
event.description: Let's learn together the basics of functional programming using Kotlin and illustrate the concepts with simple examples.

event.speaker: Andrzej Jóźwiak
event.title: IT Group in Łódź
event.subject: Kotlin dla programistów Android
event.description: Dla programistów systemu Android czas nieomalże się zatrzymał. Już niebawem pojawi się Java 9, niestety Android nierozerwalnie związany jest z archaiczną już Java 6. Programowanie funkcyjne, strumienie, wyrażenia lambda nie są domyślnie dostępne. By móc korzystać z idiomów programowania funkcyjnego, potrzebne są dodatkowe biblioteki, co w połączeniu z ekspresywnością języka Java daje nam często nadmiernie rozbudowany i nieczytelny kod. Odpowiedzią na te problemy może być język Kotlin. W trakcie prezentacji przyjrzymy się językowi Kotlin. Jakie najczęstsze bolączki jest w stanie rozwiązać? Czy i jaki narzut niesie wykorzystanie go w projekcie. Przyjrzymy się, jak wygląda wygenerowany kod na tle innych rozwiązań, takich jak Retrolambda czy Lombok oraz czy możliwe jest wykorzystanie języka Kotlin w projektach legacy.

event.speaker: Christoph Pickl
event.title: Kotlin Vienna
event.subject: What's new in Kotlin 1.1
event.description: Kotlin 1.1 has been released and has many exciting new features and improvements. Christoph will give a talk about the best new additions in Kotlin 1.1!

event.speaker: Andy Bowes
event.title: Kotlin Yorkshire Meetup Group
event.subject: Hands-on Kotlin - Learn some Kotlin by solving coding problems
event.description:
This meet up will be an opportunity to learn to program in Kotlin and to see first-hand the many features which make Kotlin such an interesting/exciting JVM language.

The evening will provide a range of problems which cover the key differences between Java & Kotlin and a range of difficulty so that there should be something to keep every bodies brain working.

event.speaker: Arold Ádám
event.title: HWSW free
event.subject: Kotlin - átállás tapasztalatok
event.description: Kotlin

event.speaker: Mohit Sarveiya
event.title: New York Kotlin Meetup
event.subject: Integrating GraphQL with Kotlin
event.description: GraphQL is a query language for APIs developed by Facebook. It allows you to retrieve only the data you need by sending a GraphQL query on the client side. In this talk, I will show you how you could integrate GraphQL with Kotlin on the server. I will demonstrate how to use the Java implementation of the GraphQL specifications with Kotlin extensions. Through examples, I will show the benefits of GraphQL versus a traditional REST API implementation.

event.speaker: Shubham Verma, Kunwar Jolly
event.title: Meetup at Daffodil Software
event.subject: Full day workshop on Kotlin April 29th, 2017.
event.description: Kotlin, the new programming language by JetBrains has taken the app development landscape by a storm. As a JVM language it is fairly easy to learn and a fun to work upon with some really helpful features like null-safe types. Today, Kotlin is an ideal option for developing large, complicated and performance-critical applications. Daffodil Software welcomes you to the next series of #MeetupAtDaffodil , featuring a full day workshop dedicated to Kotlin. Its an opportunity for you to diversify your skillset, interact with the skilled Kotlin community, learn best practices plus a lot more.Spanning over the entire day, the workshop is divided into two sessions covering the following topics.

event.speaker: Igor Buzatović
event.title: JavaCro'17 Conference
event.subject: Switching from Java to Kotlin
event.description: You want to do your everyday programming in modern language, that has nice functional programming features, that is less verbose and more concise than Java, but you don't want to give up on static type system and benefits that it provides?You want better language but you don't want to give up all java frameworks and libraries that you are using happily for years? A lot of different JVM languages emerged lately so there are many options, but if you want to switch from Java with minimum effort and risk, Kotlin is probably the best choice for you.

event.speaker: 小島領剣
event.title: D3＝Designer & Developer Division
event.subject: Android開発におけるScala, Kotlin, Java比較入門
event.description:
ついにインターネットに繋がるOSのNo.1はWindowsではなくなりAndroidになりました。 日本でもiPhoneの独裁政権は終焉を迎え、Android勢力の強みは増すばかりです。

でもAndroidエンジニアの供給が全然追いついてない。 そしていまだにJava6とか書かないといけないし。

Androidを始めてみたかったり、すでに作っていてもJava以外で書いてみたいという方も多いと思います。 そんな方向けに、ScalaとかKotlinとかでのAndroid開発をさらーっとおさらいします。

技術の深い話は期待しないでいただきたいですが、言語の違いは明確になるとは思います。

event.speaker: Thomas Girard
event.title: Open Source School Talks
event.subject: Kotlin — programming language for the JVM by JetBrains
event.description:
Créé par JetBrain, Kotlin est un langage pour la JVM 100% compatible et interopérable avec Java.

Thomas Girard vient nous présenter les fonctionnalités principales du langage lors d'un live coding intéractif.

Vous pourrez apprécier la simplicité, la puissance, mais aussi les gains de productivité, de sécurité et le plaisir d'utiliser Kotlin!

event.speaker: Ilya Zorin

event.subject: Introducing Kotlin into a production Android app
event.description: Introducing Kotlin into a production Android app (Ilya Zorin, Zalando)

event.speaker: Philipp Hauer
event.title: Clean Code Days 2017
event.subject: Cleaner Code with Kotlin
event.description: Die JVM-Sprache Kotlin ist Java deutlich überlegen. Sie vermeidet eine signifikante Menge an Boilerplate, verhindert gängige Fehler durch kluges Sprachdesign und ist obendrein auch noch besser lesbar. Zusätzlich ermutigen die Sprachkonstrukte den Entwickler zu einem besseren Softwaredesign. Das klingt doch alles sehr nach Clean Code! Tatsächlich ermöglicht es Kotlin, einfacher Clean Code zu schreiben. Oftmals geschieht dies fast wie von selbst. Aber Kotlin ist kein Allheilmittel. Der Entwickler ist am Ende immer noch selbst gefordert, die Prinzipien von Clean Code einzuhalten. In diesem Talk wird gezeigt, wie Kotlin dabei helfen kann, Clean Code zu schreiben und was es dabei zu beachten gibt.

event.speaker: Arnaud Giuliani
event.title: Android Makers Paris 2017
event.subject: Développez votre prochaine application avec Kotlin
event.description:
Kotlin est un langage développé par Jetbrains. Sa version 1.0 (production ready) est sortie en début d'année 2016, faisant un certain buzz au sein de la communauté Android. Aujourd'hui en version 1.0.6, et bientôt 1.1, Kotlin continue de susciter un vif intérêt.

Ce “nouveau“ langage est très clairement prisé, à juste titre, par la communauté android qui en est demandeuse. D'autres communautés Java, comme spring.io, s'ouvrent clairement et officiellement à ce langage.

À ekito, cela fait plus d'un an que nous travaillons sur ce langage et aujourd'hui, nous n'hésitons plus à lancer des applications en production avec Kotlin.

Cette session propose de découvrir ce langage, qui reprend certains aspects de groovy ou scala, et qui est très proche de swift dans la syntaxe et les concepts. Nous verrons comment Kotlin boost la productivité du développement d’applications Android et pourquoi vous ne pourrez plus vous en passer ;)

event.speaker: Arnaud Giuliani, Laurent Baresse
event.title: Android Makers Paris 2017
event.subject: Développez une application de météo avec Kotlin
event.description:
Kotlin est un langage de JVM développé par Jetbrains. Sa version 1.0 (production ready) est sortie en début d'année 2016 et a fait un certain buzz au sein de la communauté android. L'intérêt pour ce langage est toujours d'actualité un an après. Cette session propose de découvrir ce langage, qui reprend certains aspects de groovy ou scala, et qui est très proche de swift dans la syntaxe et les concepts.

Ce “nouveau“ langage est très clairement prisé, à juste titre, par la communauté android qui en est demandeuse. D'autres communautés Java, comme spring.io, s'ouvrent clairement et officiellement à ce langage.

Ce “handson“ vous propose de monter une application android 100% Kotlin, afin d'y découvrir différentes thématiques du langage. On débutera par une presentation de Kotlin, pour balayer les points intéressants du langage de manière pragmatique (ce qui est intéressant au quotidien) et aller jusque la programmation fonctionnelle et réactive (avec Rx). Ensuite, un TP de 2h se déroulera autour de l'application de démo.

Pré-requis : AndroidStudio 2.2+, Android SDK API 24, Build tools 24.0.3+, plugin Kotlin 1.0.6+ et GIT installés sur son portable.

event.speaker: Akshay Chordiya
event.title: Pune Mobile Developers
event.subject: Kotlin-ize your Android Development
event.description:
Since Android took the world by storm, we have had no alternatives to Java for android app development. Although its usage is widespread, Java comes with a lot of historical baggage. Java 8 solved few of the language issues, but to use it a minimum SDK version of 24 is required

Kotlin aims to fill that gap of a missing modern language for the Android platform. Lets explore Kotlin for android app development in this meetup.

event.speaker: Hadi Hariri
event.title: Genome Campus Software Craftsmanship Community
event.subject: Kotlin – Ready for production
event.description:
Did you know that Kotlin is being used in production for over a few years now already? Both inside and outside of JetBrains there are people deploying Kotlin applications for Android platform, for Web Applications and just about any other type of application.

Why are people using it instead of Java or some of the other languages out there? Primarily because it provides significant benefits in terms of conciseness, readability and safety, without some of the drawbacks that adopting a new language has such as a higher learning curve or interoperability with existing code and ecosystems.

In this talk we’ll cover some aspects of Kotlin that can really help you in your daily development, focusing on solving issues versus highlighting language features.

event.speaker: Svetlana Isakova
event.title: Voxxed Days Athens
event.subject: You can do better with Kotlin
event.description:
The Kotlin programming language is gaining popularity amongst the Java developer community. It’s a modern language that gives more power in everyday routines.

Kotlin code generally looks cleaner and nicer, and it’s much easier to work with when you have less verbosity or code duplication. But what’s even more important, is that Kotlin is 100% compatible with all existing Java frameworks, and has good tooling (it’s from JetBrains after all).

In this talk, we’ll discuss the concepts of the language that provide the desired expressiveness, as well as new important features introduced in the latest Koltin release.

event.speaker: Christina Lee
event.title: Droidcon Italy 2017
event.subject: Kotlin: A Followup
event.description:
Intro

— recap basics of why kotlin vs Java

— recap interop

Roadblocks & Considerations

— team adoption

— integration of disparate skill sets (i.e. Java devs reviewing code for Kotlin devs and vice versa)

— precedents for when and how to use

— getting buy in from with executives and tech leads

— recruiting and hiring considerations

— updating release processes to accomodate hybrid codebase

— tooling failures and incompatabilites

— linters and style guides

— separation of concerns: language choice versus architectural decision (i.e. MVP can be done in Java or Kotlin, but doing it in Kotlin allows you to write it differently)

Conclusions:

— open questions we still have at Pinterest almost a year after introduction

— resources for devs looking to manage the political/organizational side of introducing a new language to a company

At this point in time, most Android developers have heard of Kotlin and are familiar with some of its advantages. In previous talks, I’ve covered why and how developers in large companies can attempt to introduce a new language, and all of it’s associated paradigims, into a legacy codebase. In this talk, we’ll cover some of the more advanced components of introducing a new language, including onboarding new team members, orchestrating team wide trainings, setting code and style guidelines, and adapting existing infrastructure tools to accept hybrid codebases. This talk aims to go beyond the why’s of adopting Kotlin and into the how’s of actually doing it, giving the developer a framework to use when thinking about adopting (or not) Kotlin into their own codebase.

event.description: 플러그인 개발환경 설정과 IntellJ Plugin API를 살펴보며, 이를 배포하는 방법과 코틀린으로 포팅할 때 유의할 점에 대해 다룹니다.

event.speaker: Jozef Kňažko
event.title: Codecon 2017
event.subject: O Kotline a Androide
event.description: Príbeh o tom ako sa jeden Android vývojár odmietol kamarátiť s Javou a kam ho to priviedlo. Čo to je Kotlin, výhody a nevýhody oproti Jave a jeho prínos pri vývoji mobilných aplikácií. Praktické zhrnutie po trojročných skúsenostiach.

event.speaker: Colin Lee
event.title: MinneBar 2017
event.subject: Kotlin: Java for the New Millenium
event.description: We'll discuss how Kotlin builds on top of Java to improve Android and server software development.

event.speaker: Cristian Monforte
event.title: Google Developer Group Barcelona
event.subject: Kotlin, del No al...¡Si!
event.description: En esta ocasión Cristian Monforte, desarrollador Android en Xing nos hablará sobre los retos que se ha ido encontrando su equipo para introducir Kotlin en el código de su aplicación y de como pasó de ser reticente a ello a descubrir las ventajas que les aportaba.

event.speaker: Kai Koenig
event.title: Wellington.kt
event.subject: Let's learn more about Kotlin and do some Koans
event.description: At the first meetup there was an interest in learning more about Kotlin and quite a few people thought it'd be nice to work through some Kotlin Koans together.

event.speaker: Matt Runo
event.title: GDG Las Vegas
event.subject: Kotlin for fun and profit.
event.description: Stop doing it wrong! With a modern language called Kotlin, you can do it right - faster - and with less bugs! We’ll go over what you need to know to dive into your first Kotlin project.. syntax, basic structure, and how to not be lost when you’re listening to a more advanced discussion of Kotlin’s features. You don’t need to know Java, but some familiarity with object oriented languages will help you follow along with this short introduction to the Kotlin language.

event.speaker: Sergey Gevelev
event.title: Android Meetup Uzhhorod
event.subject: Don`t worry — switch to Kotlin
event.description: Доповідь буде корисною і для тих, хто вже має досвід програмування на мові Java, і хто хоче подивитися як Kotlin функціонує на практиці. Буде розглянуто як можна вирішити одне і теж саме завдання використовуючи Java і Kotlin, а також яким чином Kotlin може стати в нагоді при розробці мобільних додатків на платформі android.

event.speaker: Deny Prasetyo
event.title: JVM Meetup
event.subject: Build your services with Kotlin
event.description: JVM Meet Up is a periodic community-based event discussing about nuts and bolts of programming language using Java VM platform. As you all may know, there are lots of programming languages that run on top of Java VM; such as Java itself, Groovy, JRuby, Jython, Clojure, Scala and Kotlin. The last one will detailed on this event

event.speaker: Budi Oktaviyan
event.title: JVM Meetup
event.subject: Android Magic with Kotlin
event.description: JVM Meet Up is a periodic community-based event discussing about nuts and bolts of programming language using Java VM platform. As you all may know, there are lots of programming languages that run on top of Java VM; such as Java itself, Groovy, JRuby, Jython, Clojure, Scala and Kotlin. The last one will detailed on this event

event.title: Perú Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Kotlin para desarrolladores Android
event.description: Los invitamos al primer meetup de la comunidad

event.speaker: Kevin Salazar Llashag
event.title: Perú Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Kotlin Extensions
event.description: Los invitamos al primer meetup de la comunidad

event.speaker: Kai Koenig
event.title: Wellington.kt
event.subject: Functions and classes in Kotlin
event.description:
The topic of this first session will be an introductory one - we're talking about some Kotlin fundamentals: functions and classes.

The idea is to look at the concepts, then gain a shared understanding and maybe do a few of the Kotlin Koans on these topics together.

event.speaker: César Eduardo Licea
event.title: Android GDLActivity
event.subject: 8 dias libres... "a aprender kotlin"
event.description:
Paso el mes del amor, le llaman "Febrero loco y marzo otro poco" asi que es tiempo de darle continuidad a nuestro meetup y hablar de Android como nos gusta.

Regresamos como cada mes con 3 nuevas platicas y esperando que nos acompañen, traigan a sus amiguitos y amiguitas y vengan a pasar un rato magico y maravilloso en compañia de los mas cercanos a ustedes: otros desarrolladores.

En este mes, la gente de Luxoft nos presta sus instalaciones para poder reunirnos a comer pizza y beber cerveza y claro, hablar de Android.

event.speaker: Kai Koenig
event.title: GDG Melbourne
event.subject: The Ultimate Ninja of Kotlin Libraries
event.description: Kai will be delivering a remote presentation on Kotlin Libraries. Kotlin is a new language for the JVM that aims to be a "better Java". Made in-house by Jetbrains, the company behind IntelliJ IDEA and also Android Studio, it's been in development for more than 5 years. Just a few weeks ago the final version of Kotlin 1.0 saw the light of day.

event.speaker: 藤田 琢磨
event.title: 【学生＆若手エンジニア向け勉強会】
event.subject: Kotlin入門（ハンズオン有） 言語の紹介〜プロダクト導入の知見まで
event.description:
サポーターズが贈るエンジニア勉強会。

今回のテーマは「今こそ学ぶ、Kotlin入門」。

KotlinはJetBrainsが作った言語で2016年の2月にv1がリリースされました。

Null安全・拡張関数・関数リテラル等の魅力があり、正式リリース以降、

サーバやAndroidなどでの導入事例が増えてきています。

Kotlinの文法のハンズオンから導入の知見までを共有し、

参加者がKotlinをふわっとその場で習得することを目指します。

サーバ・Androidエンジニアだけではなく、

iOSをSwiftで書いている人やAndroid始めたいと思っている方にもおすすめです！

event.speaker: Hadi Hariri
event.title: Voxxed Days CERN
event.subject: Kotlin – Ready for production
event.description:
Did you know that Kotlin is being used in production for over a few years now already? Both inside and outside of JetBrains there are people deploying Kotlin applications for Android platform, for Web Applications and just about any other type of application.

Why are people using it instead of Java or some of the other languages out there? Primarily because it provides significant benefits in terms of conciseness, readability and safety, without some of the drawbacks that adopting a new language has such as a higher learning curve or interoperability with existing code and ecosystems.

In this talk we’ll cover some aspects of Kotlin that can really help you in your daily development, focusing on solving issues versus highlighting language features.

event.speaker: Kota Mizushima
event.title: Scala Matsuri 2017
event.subject: Kotlin for Scala Programmers
event.description: Kotlin, created by JetBrains, is an application development language for Android that has been getting a lot of attention lately. Kotlin emits JVM bytecode and has its own lightweight runtime library. It is also very easy to learn because its language syntax is greatly influenced by Scala. This talk will present an introduction to Kotlin for Scala programmers.

event.title: Scala Matsuri 2016
event.subject: Kotlin Hands on
event.description: Hands on session with Kotlin

event.speaker: Leonid Rudenko
event.title: Selenium Camp
event.subject: Excuse me, sir, do you have a moment to talk about tests in Kotlin?
event.description:
Do you remember why your tests are written in language X? Because the project is being developed in language X? It was teamlead’s decision? Do you know good libraries and tools for language X? Maybe it’s time to try to write tests in language Y?

Yes, the tests’ language may differ from the project’s language. And if you are using Java, there are reasons why your tests’ language can be Kotlin. Don’t be afraid, Kotlin is not a rocket science. I’ll tell you how the features of this language make it possible to spend less time on the tests’ support. How strong typing can be similar to the dynamic one. And why your favorite libraries will stay with you. And, of course, the main thing – how to start. Where possible, a comparison with Java and Groovy will be made.

If you do test automation or you develop in Java/Groovy – come to my talk.

event.speaker: Ilyes Bekaddour
event.title: UConf 2.0
event.subject: Kotlin
event.description: définitions, qualités, et objectifs de Kotlin

event.speaker: Mike Gouline
event.title: Android Australia User Group
event.subject: Kotlin, the pragmatic language for Android
event.description: Kotlin, a relatively new programming language running on the JVM, has been making headlines as the more elegant alternative to Java in any of its applications. One of them is Android development and this talk will explore the benefits that the language offers for everyday coding

event.speaker: Armando Picón
event.title: Droidcon Santo Domingo
event.subject: Kotlin for Android Developers
event.description: An introduction talk about how Kotlin can help to Android Developer to improve their app development.

event.speaker: Juraj Palaščák
event.title: Night of Chances Technology
event.subject: Why Kotlin beats Java (Basics)
event.description: Why should we start using Kotlin today for pleasant Android development. I'll present small app written in both Java and Kotlin, compare differences and introduce helpful timesavers.

event.speaker: Olivier Hubaut
event.title: BruJUG - The Brussels Java User Group
event.subject: Kotlin: Less boilerplate, More fun!
event.description:
Kotlin has gained some traction amongst the Android developers that were stuck with Java 6. But what did push JetBrains to invent a new language in the first place, and how did they tried to solve the issues they were facing with Java?

In this talk, you will be introduced to concepts and the syntax of the language. We'll dive in what makes it so pragmatic and how it can interoperate with Java.

event.speaker: Bas Cancrinus
event.title: Kotlin user group Berlin
event.subject: Kotlin
event.description: We're getting together in an informal setting to share our knowledge of Kotlin and catch up. Please step up when you're willing to present something you've done with Kotlin.

event.speaker: Евгений Шишкин
event.title: GDG St. Petersburg
event.subject: Kotlin в продакшн: опыт внедрения Kotlin в большой Android проект на Java
event.description: В феврале 2016 года состоялся релиз первой версии языка Kotlin. Вокруг этого события поднялось большое количество хайпа среди Android-разработчиков. Многие стали пробовать писать на Kotlin Android-приложения. Весь синтаксический сахар, поддержка иммутабельности, null-safety, extension функции и многое другое выглядело весьма соблазнительно на фоне Java 7. В компании Aviasales тоже не могли пройти мимо данного релиза. Евгений расскажет про тернистый путь миграции крупного продакшн проекта на Kotlin и как теперь с этим живется.

event.speaker: Станислав Ерохин
event.title: GDG St. Petersburg
event.subject: Новые возможности kotlin1.1 и будущее языка
event.description: Вы услышите, что же нового готовится в релизе 1.1. Будут рассмотрены реальные примеры использования новых фич языка, а также показаны ситуации, в которых эти фичи помогут сделать ваш код более выразительным и кратким. Также будет рассказано о планах развития языка.

event.speaker: Андрей Бреслав
event.title: GDG St. Petersburg
event.subject: Q&A сессия с создателем языка Kotlin
event.description: Андрей Бреслав с радостью ответит на все интересующие вас вопросы по существующим возможностям языка, о том, что ждать в Kotlin 2.0, а также что такое — этот таинственный Kotlin Native.

event.speaker: Arnaud Giuliani
event.title: Devoxx France 2017
event.subject: Venez développer une application Android météo en Kotlin
event.description: This is a 3 hours hands-on session to take a tour of the Kotlin language on a real app (a weather application). During the workshop, we will see several presentation about language features. Then we will work on precise cases, in a pragmatic way

event.title: Montpellier Android User Group
event.subject: Kotlin
event.description: Thomas Girard nous présentera Kotlin, détails à venir mais il devrait y avoir du live coding après une présentation du langage.

event.description: 3 days of Kotlin Workshop in Saigon, from 0 to 10.

event.title: North Wales Tech
event.subject: Kotlin
event.description: Continuing the theme of CodeJams looking at particular languages, this time we'll be looking at languages that run on the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) such as Kotlin, Clojure, Ceylon and Scala.

event.speaker: Rob Shepherd
event.title: BarCoders #2
event.subject: Tworzenie aplikacji na Android w języku Kotlin
event.description: Porozmawiamy o oprogramowaniu wpływającym na rzeczywistość, o tym jak tworzyć aplikacje mobilne językiem Kotlin, developmencie aplikacji z Dockerem, koncepcji CQRS oraz doprawianiu swojego Javascrptu czyli krótko o curry i programowaniu funkcyjnym.

event.subject: Kobalt - modern build tool written in Kotlin
event.title: Kotlin Night in Warsaw
event.speaker: Juan Liska
event.description: Kobalt - modern build tool written in Kotlin. I will present this relatively new (1.5 years old) build tool that lets you write build configurations in Kotlin

event.subject: Kotlin for Java Developers
event.title: Kotlin Night Riga
event.speaker: Ruslan Ibragimov
event.description:
Kotlin is a statically typed language with strong support for both classic OO and object-functional approaches. Kotlin already became main language for many backend and android developers. In this talk we re going to learn Kotlin from the ground up. Topics covered: syntax, interoperability with Java.

I'm currently also trying to get a second speaker from the Kotlin community with more experience who might either substitute me or dive deeper into this language with us. In any case, there will be giveaways for Kotlin fans.

event.subject: Kotlin & Android
event.title: Kotlin Night Riga
event.speaker: Sergejs Luhmirins
event.description: For a long time android developers were struggling with old Java versions and enviously looked at backend developers using their fancy streams and lambdas. Thanks to Kotlin those times are over. Now any Android developer can use latest and greatest language features, gain from mixing different paradigms and much more. In this talk I will highlight how Kotlin may be beneficial to any Android developer.

event.subject: Introduction to Bootique and Kotlin Gradle
event.title: Kotlin Night Riga
event.speaker: Ruslan Ibragimov
event.description:
Today, many Java developers are tired of the complexity and the bulkiness of containers and existing frameworks.

Bootique is a simple and universal solution to these problems. At the core of Bootique are three pillars that provide developers with everything they need for building an application.

event.subject: 365 Dias de Kotlin
event.title: Kotlin Night São Paulo 2017
event.speaker: Philipe Steiff e Felippe Bisca
event.description:
Estamos muito felizes de anunciar que o nosso primeiro evento será o Kotlin Night São Paulo 2017, evento oficial de Kotlin realizado pela JetBrains no mundo inteiro, sendo essa a primeira edição Kotlin Night realizado na América do Sul!

O objetivo desse evento é dar um pontapé inicial na comunidade de Kotlin em São Paulo, além de trazer experiências de grandes empresas com a utilização da linguagem.

O objetivo desse evento é dar um pontapé inicial na comunidade de Kotlin em São Paulo, além de trazer experiências de grandes empresas com a utilização da linguagem.

Estamos muito felizes de anunciar que o nosso primeiro evento será o Kotlin Night São Paulo 2017, evento oficial de Kotlin realizado pela JetBrains no mundo inteiro, sendo essa a primeira edição Kotlin Night realizado na América do Sul!

O objetivo desse evento é dar um pontapé inicial na comunidade de Kotlin em São Paulo, além de trazer experiências de grandes empresas com a utilização da linguagem.

event.subject: An introduction to Kotlin by example
event.title: Riga DevDays 2017
event.speaker: Dmitry Kandalov
event.description:
Kotlin is what Java 9 should have been if it was written from scratch.

The goal of this session is to introduce audience to Kotlin programming language. The session is mostly live coding demo based on small programming problems written in Kotlin. It starts with "hello world" and continues to more complex examples ending with Kotlin puzzlers.

Target audience: software developers familiar with Java (Groovy, Scala or similar language).

event.subject: Kotlin
event.title: Grand Rapids Java Users Group
event.speaker: Dan Lindeman
event.description: Java is great, but is there anything out there better? This talk will cover languages that some think are better than Java, but still take advantage of the JVM. In this talk, Dan Lindeman of Blue Medora talks about Kotlin and how it can make your teams more productive.

event.subject: Kotlin
event.title: CodeJam: A Cup Full of JVM
event.speaker: David Hunnisett
event.description:
Continuing the theme of CodeJams looking at particular languages, this time we'll be looking at languages that run on the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) such as Kotlin, Clojure and maybe even Scala.

The format will be a Kata of sorts where teams will pick one of the JVM languages to all work on the same Kata to later compare how they got on with the different languages.

event.subject: Kotlin and Android Development - How do we use Kotlin in our Cookpad Android app?
event.title: Android Talks @Cookpad
event.speaker: Kittinun Vantasin
event.description: Meet people, learn stuff, share things about Android Development

event.subject: Fun With Kotlin
event.title: Android Developer meetup
event.speaker: Sebastian Chlan
event.description: An introduction to Kotlin by the handsome Sebastian Chlan (Zendesk)

event.subject: Sputnik - A Gradle Plugin Through Kotlin
event.title: Android Developer meetup
event.speaker: Elliot Tormey
event.description: The Elliot Tormey (Tapadoo) Gradle plugin for developers that can’t version good and want to do some proguard things too

event.subject: First few months with Kotlin - Introduction through Android examples
event.title: Kotlin User Group Serbia
event.speaker: Nebojša Vukšić
event.description:
Predavač Nebojša Vukšić će predstaviti programski jezlik Kotlin i većinu najvažnijih feature-a ovog jezika kroz njegovu primenu u razvoju android aplikacija. Poznavanje razvoja Android aplikacija nije neophodno da bi se razumeli svi koncepti ovog jezika.

Ujedno ovo će biti prilika da predstavimo planove Kotlin korisničke grupe javnosti i da pozovemo sve zainteresovane koji žele da učestvuju u ovom projektu da predlože svoje ideje organizatorima.

event.subject: Kotlin features for Android
event.title: Mobile Dev Meetup
event.speaker: Valentin Iorgu
event.description:
The Android development experience has improved considerably in the last couple of years thanks to some great libraries and tooling improvements but we're still stuck with an outdated version of Java while other platforms get shiny new toys like Swift.

You might have heard of Kotlin (also during our last meetup), but how exactly does it help? In this presentation we'll go over several Kotlin features that help reduce boilerplate, can increase the stability of your codebase and enhance the overall development experience.

We'll explore things like inline functions, reified generics, receiver lambdas, delegated properties, sneak peak at coroutines and more.

event.subject: Kotlin
event.title: GDG Rhein-Main
event.speaker: Marc Reichelt
event.description: It's been a long time! Let's kickoff this year with a GDG meetup about machine learning, self-driving cars and more! Also let's share stuff about your favorite languages - Kotlin, Dart, you name it!

event.subject: Faster development using Anko on Kotlin
event.title: GDG New Delhi
event.speaker: Vatsal Bajpai

event.subject: Two months of Kotlin
event.title: GDG Bologna
event.speaker: Erik Minarini
event.description: Kotlin é un linguaggio conciso e sicuro che puó essere usato come alternativa a Java o al fianco di esso nello sviluppo di applicazioni Android native. Questo talk tratta del primo impatto che ho avuto con questo linguaggio dopo averlo utilizzato per più di due mesi, dei suoi pregi e del perché esso stia prendendo sempre piú piede.

event.subject: Functional Reactive Programming with Kotlin
event.title: Mobile Tea #14: Mobile and the City
event.speaker: Giorgio Natili
event.description: Reactive programming is a paradigm oriented around data flows and propagation of changes. Kotlin is a programming language intended to be a better Java, and it's designed to be usable and readable across large teams with skill and discipline variances. Despite its object-oriented building blocks, Kotlin fits well in the functional reactive programming landscape. In this essay, I will deep-dive into the most relevant aspects of FRP in Kotlin focusing on the advantages that everyone can get when using this approach to build an Android app. (speech level: intermediate; duration: 20 minutes)

event.subject: Introduction to the the Kotlin programming language with Alberto Arias
event.title: Toronto Java Users Group
event.speaker: Alberto Arias
event.description:
Let's take a quick tour at the basic features of this modern, and pragmatic language for the JVM. Kotlin is an open-sourced statically-typed programming language created by JetBrains that targets the JVM or JavaScript; It’s designed to interoperate 100% with Java code easily, and allows gradual adoption.

Content

• Why kotlin?

• Installation

• The REPL

• Data types and declaring variables

• Loops and ranges

• Control structures

• OOP: Classes, Objects,

• and Null safety

event.subject: Kotlin for Android
event.title: TechAtAgoda #6: Let's talk Mobile
event.speaker: Tomasz Morcinek
event.description: We are excited to invite you to our #6 meet-up that will be in mobile mark, we will share our mobile knowledge with you.This meet-up will be divided into 2 tracks, one will be about iOS and the other Android.

event.subject: Kotlin für den Build Master
event.title: JavaLand 2017
event.speaker: Dirk Dittert
event.description: Kotlin ist eine statisch typisierte Programmiersprache für die Java VM, die sich für eine Vielzahl von Einsatzmöglichkeiten eignet  von der AndroidEntwicklung bis zum Gradle-Build-Skript. Für den Build Master lohnt es sich, einen Blick auf die Sprache zu werfen, da die täglichen Werkzeuge seit kurzem Kotlin unterstützen: Gradle 3 ermöglicht die Erstellung von Build-Skripten in Kotlin statt wie bisher in Groovy, wodurch z.B. wesentlich bessere Code-Vervollständigung in der IDE möglich wird. Aber auch Build-Konfigurationen für TeamCity können direkt mit Kotlin programmiert und in der Versionsverwaltung abgelegt werden.

event.subject: Curso presencial: Kotlin para desarrolladores Android
event.title: Kotlin para desarrolladores Android
event.speaker: Antonio Leiva
event.description:
¡NUEVA EDICIÓN DEL CURSO PRESENCIAL!

Aprende a crear una aplicación con Kotlin en un día.

El único curso especializado para aprender Kotlin desde cero mientras desarrollas una aplicación Android

En una jornada intensiva interiorizarás todos los conceptos del lenguaje necesarios para crear una app en Android.

Puede que la idea de aprender un lenguaje nuevo te haga pensar que vas a tener que dedicar demasiadas horas a analizar y escribir código hasta dominarlo con un experto. Puede que te preguntes si merecerá la pena el esfuerzo.
Sin embargo, el caso de Kotlin es diferente. Es tan sencillo que un curso intensivo de un día es suficiente para conocer todos los conceptos que necesitas para crear tu primera app utilizando Kotlin como lenguaje principal. Te lo garantizo. Es así porque Kotlin ha sido ideado para facilitar la transición desde Java.
El tiempo que dediques a aprender el lenguaje será tiempo que ganarás en el desarrollo diario de tus proyectos utilizando Kotlin.
Porque los nuevos conceptos que introduce Kotlin te ahorrarán líneas de código innecesarias y te darán soluciones impensables con Java a día de hoy.


Las compañías tecnológicas ya han empezado a utilizar Kotlin para desarrollar sus aplicaciones porque es un lenguaje maduro, que se integra a la perfección con Android Studio, es estable y seguro.
Dominarlo te permitirá situarte a la vanguardia en el desarrollo de apps Android. Cuando la demanda sea masiva estarás preparado para aprovechar las oportunidades profesionales.

Con Kotlin for Android Developers aprenderás en un día:

- A crear una App desde cero utilizando Kotlin: Todos los conceptos básicos necesarios para crear una app.

- A aplicar el lenguaje a Android: Las características exclusivas para Android y la interacción con el framework.

- A utilizar las herramientas de desarrollo: Aprenderás a integrar Kotlin en Android Studio y a utilizarlo en tus proyectos.

- De forma cien por cien práctica: A partir de ejemplos y escribiendo código.

- En un grupo reducido: Seremos un máximo de 15 personas, para poder dedicarte tiempo individualizado.

REQUISITOS: Fluidez con el Framework de Android y portátil propio con la última versión estable de Android Studio.

El acceso al curso presencial incluye nueve horas intensivas de formación presencial en las que aprenderás a crear una App con Kotlin desde cero.

Y además recibirás de forma gratuita…

- El libro en papel Kotlin for Android Developers (in inglés) (29€)
- Soporte por email durante un mes (97€)
- Acceso a mi comunidad privada de desarrolladores de Facebook (97€)
- El curso online Superpoderes para convertirte en un Desarrollador de Éxito (47€)

Me llamo Antonio Leiva, soy Android Engineer.

Desde que descubrí Kotlin en 2015 me he dedicado a exprimirlo al máximo para volcar todo su potencial en el desarrollo de aplicaciones para Android.

Mi objetivo con este curso es trasladarte esos conocimientos, mostrarte cómo utilizar Kotlin en un entorno Android en nueve horas de formación intensiva para que puedas mejorar tu productividad, saltar los límites de otros lenguajes y destacar como desarrollador aplicando un código moderno, sencillo y funcional.

Más información: https://devexperto.com/kotlin-desarrolladores-android-presencial/

event.subject: Kotlin en Acción
event.title: Kotlin en Acción para Android Developers
event.speaker: Armando Picon, Lima Perú
event.description: Este taller está diseñado para introducir a los desarrolladores android en el uso de este lenguaje de programación. Se hará un repaso de los conceptos básicos del lenguaje y cómo estos pueden aplicarse en el desarrollo de aplicaciones Android.

event.subject: Kotlin: Customer Review
event.title: Functional Miners - 02.2017
event.speaker: Mateusz Sulima
event.description: Chciałbym przedstawić mocne i słabe strony Kotlina zauważone po pół roku korzystania na produkcji. Szczególnie skupię się na porównaniu do jego bliskich krewnych - Javy i Scali.

event.subject: Java 6++: Moderne Android-Entwicklung mit Kotlin
event.title: JavaLand 2017
event.speaker: Benjamin Schmid
event.description:
Android-Entwickler können nur sehnsüchtig seufzen: Die neuen Möglichkeiten aus Java 8 wie funktionale Programmierung, Lambdas oder Streams bleiben ihnen noch vorenthalten. Grund: Die Android-Plattform steckt weitgehend noch auf Java 6 fest. Abhilfe schafft hier die JVM-Sprache Kotlin, die nach über fünf Jahren Entwicklung mittlerweile die stabile Version 1.0 erreicht hat. Kotlin verspricht nicht nur weniger Boilerplate Code dank einer ausdrucksstarken und gut lesbaren Syntax mit funktionalen Features. Nein - eine vollständige Binärkompatibilität mit Java 6, die nahtlose Interoperabilität mit bestehenden Java-Code und eine enge Integration in die Android Studio IDE machen Kotlin auch für die moderne Android-Entwicklung zu einer idealen Alternative.

In dieser Session erleben wir live, wie es sich anfühlt, der NullpointerException auf Nimmerwiedersehen zu sagen und sie in für die App-Entwicklung gegen funktionale Features, Dataclasses und Extension-Methods einzutauschen. Eine kleine Beispiel-App hilft beim Kennenlernen und vermittelt lebendige Eindrücke, sodass auch Android-Neulinge gut folgen können. Tools wie wie Anko und die Kotlin Android Extensions unterstützen beim Bändigen des Android SDK. Am Ende konnten wir hoffentlich nicht nur viel Lust und Inspiration auf eigene Experimente und Versuche anregen, sondern auch interessante Einblicke in die Programmiersprache sowie ihren Einsatz unter Android im Speziellen mitnehmen.

event.subject: Kotlin in Practice
event.title: JUG Saxony Camp Leipzig 2017
event.speaker: Philipp Hauer
event.description: We speak about the introduction of Kotlin at Spreadshirt and the experience we made with this great language. We show how the development with popular frameworks (like Spring, Jackson and Vaadin) can benefit from Kotlin.

event.subject: Let's go to discover Kotlin!
event.title: Devoxx France
event.speaker: David Wursteisen, Mounir Boudraa
event.description: Kotlin is between Java and Scala : more powerfull than Java with immutable class, extensions method, and other features, without be as complex as Scala. While building an interactive movie catalogues, discover with us major Kotlin features, Java integration, how Kotlin can be a productive language and how it help you to be more productive.

event.subject: An introduction to Kotlin by example
event.title: ACCU 2017
event.speaker: Dmitry Kandalov
event.description:
Kotlin is a new programming language for the JVM (and JavaScript VM) by JetBrains. It is a statically typed language designed to include the most pragmatic features from Java, Groovy, C# and Scala. Kotlin is what Java 9 should have been in an ideal world.

This session is an overview of Kotlin features using code examples and comparison with other JVM languages. The idea is to move from compiling and running "hello world" to more advanced examples, encounter some Kotlin puzzlers along the way and finish with actual program written in Kotlin (most likely Snake game).

event.subject: 解剖 Kotlin ~バイトコードを読み解く~
event.title: DroidKaigi 2017
event.speaker: Toshihiro Yagi
event.description: Kotlinの特徴的な機能としてnull許容型や関数型や拡張関数などがよく取り沙汰されます。null安全だとか高階関数で簡潔に記述だとか拡張関数便利最高といった話は枚挙に暇がありません。確かに言語機能としていろいろとJavaに比べて便利なのは分かるんだけど、でもまぁ別にJavaを使っていてクリティカルに困っているわけではないしな〜学習コストとかチームへの導入コストを考えるとそこまで旨味を感じられるわけでもないしな〜みたいなそんな気分。わかります。 本セッションではKotlinのコードをコンパイルして得られるJavaバイトコードを、可読化したりデコンパイルする事によって、Kotlinの特徴的な言語機能がJavaでどのように表現されているかを読み解いていきます。これによりKotlinが肩代わりしてくれるボイラープレートコード群を明らかにします。Kotlinを使うことで省略できたボイラープレートコードが可読性をどのように高め、設計に影響を与えるのかについても言及します。 目次案

ここ数年、注目を集めているJVM言語 Kotlin（ことりん）をテーマに開催します。 JJUGナイトセミナーとしてKotlinを取り上げるのは今回が初めて

Kotlinは、IntelliJ IDEAなどのIDEでおなじみのJetBrainsにより開発されているプログラミング言語です。 Java言語が動く環境を主要なターゲットとしており、その活躍の幅はサーバサイド、デスクトップ、モバイルなど多岐へ渡ります。 近日リリース予定のバージョン1.1やSpring frameworkのKotlinサポートなど、今ホットな言語であると言えるでしょう。

event.subject: Kotlin Talk
event.title: Android Developer Group Nürnberg
event.speaker: Nino Handler
event.description:
This time we will be talking about Kotlin. And I'm not talking about the Russian island and I won't either compare it to the Indonesian island Java, but talk about both as a language. I recently started learning Kotlin and my talk will introduce you to my first month with Kotlin, things I liked and things I really didn't understand.

I'm currently also trying to get a second speaker from the Kotlin community with more experience who might either substitute me or dive deeper into this language with us. In any case, there will be giveaways for Kotlin fans.

event.subject: Kotlin all the... tests!
event.title: Mobius conference
event.speaker: Danny Preussler
event.description: Kotlin was the rising star of programming languages in 2016. Not only did it get to version 1.0 but also got rapidly adopted in the Android community. But many companies are struggling to add Kotlin to an existing Java project. It's not easy to add a new language to an existing team. It's much easier to introduce Kotlin to your project using the backdoor: your unit tests. So let's look at Kotlin more from a testing perspective. How does writing tests in Kotlin look like, what possibilities of the language will help us?

event.subject: Kotlin - der neue Stern am Java Himmel?
event.title: Java User Group Hamburg
event.speaker: Dirk Dittert
event.description:
Schreiben Sie immer noch ellenlangen Boilerplate Code und stolpern in Ihren Projekten über Nullpointer Exceptions? Mit Kotlin gehört beides der Vergangenheit an! Kotlin ist eine statisch typisierte Sprache, die für die Entwicklung großer Projekte wie gemacht ist. Dabei besticht sie sowohl mit einer flachen Lernkurve als auch einer hervorragenden Kompatibilität zu bestehendem Java Code.

Gemeinsam unterziehen wir die kürzlich erschienene erste offizielle Version der Sprache einem Praxistest und lernen durch praxisnahe Codebeispiele die Unterschiede zu Java kennen. Ein Blick auf die verfügbaren Frameworks rundet den Vortrag ab. Ob Kotlin die Erwartungen erfüllen kann?

event.subject: Kotlin for Android: The future is now
event.title: KotlinMAD
event.speaker: Antonio Leiva
event.description: Kotlin has come to stay, and it's the perfect time to start using it. Are you bored programming with Java on Android? Tired of seeing how your code is full of NullPointerException? Tired of not being able to use the latest features in modern languages? Thanks to Kotlin, we have a new world of possibilities ahead, hard to imagine until now in Android App development. In this talk we'll see how Kotlin makes interaction with the Android framework easier, how it reduces the complexity of the code and improves its readability, making our apps more robust and maintainable.

event.subject: Kotlin @PeakGames
event.title: Javaday Istanbul
event.speaker: ilkin Balkanay
event.description: We have 5 successful Android games written in Java programming language. We constantly add new features to these games and we will continue adding new features to them over the next 5 years. Although, we love the Java programming language, we have decided to develop new features in our games using the Kotlin programming language, a modern and pragmatic language. In this presentation you will learn why Kotlin becomes a worthwhile programming language, what the process of learning the language is, and how we solve the problems encountered when adding new features to the existing games with Kotlin.

event.description: That event is a workshop where people will discover differences between Kotlin and swift mainly for non mobile development. It is organized with the GDG Toulouse.

event.subject: Future of Kotlin: Strategy and Tactics
event.title: JPoint
event.speaker: Andrey Breslav
event.description: A successful project usually grows, and Kotlin is no exception. We are adding new targets (JavaScript and Native) and new computation models (coroutines). This talk is about our vision of the future of Kotlin as a language and an ecosystem. We'll talk strategy: what we think our industry needs at large and how we are going to fit Kotlin into this picture. We'll talk tactics: how we deal with legacy and compatibility issues, and whether there will ever be Kotlin 2.0. We'll talk operations: can we do “continuous delivery” for language features? Or, more generally, how agile can language development be?

event.subject: Kotlin Puzzlers
event.title: JPoint
event.speaker: Anton Keks
event.description: Kotlin is a marvelous alternative language for the JVM, aiming to improve usability of aging Java. While not exactly new, it has been quickly gaining adoption since its 1.0 release in 2016. Anton will give a brief introduction and present Puzzlers of Kotlin — the gotchas that you may encounter while digging deeper into the language. While Kotlin was in development for 6 years, and aimed to be a perfect practical language, like all other languages, it still has tricky parts that you don't find in the documentation.

This talk is about our vision of the future of Kotlin as a language and an ecosystem. We'll talk strategy: what we think our industry needs at large and how we are going to fit Kotlin into this picture. We'll talk tactics: how we deal with legacy and compatibility issues, and whether there will ever be Kotlin 2.0. We'll talk operations: can we do “continuous delivery” for language features? Or, more generally, how agile can language development be?.

event.subject: Kotlin: Uncovered
event.title: Droidcon Boston
event.speaker: Victoria Gonda
event.description: Kotlin does a lot for us in the way of reducing boilerplate. But what is it really doing? We will be inspecting some decompiled Kotlin to discover how it does its job. By looking underneath at how it handles data classes, lambdas, and delegation, we can better understand how the language executes what we write. If you’re curious about the language, or already using it in production, you should walk away from this investigation with a deeper understanding of Kotlin, and some tools for continued exploration.

Even if you have never seen Kotlin before, come and see how you will create better apps with this modern and elegant language. At the end of this talk you’ll be able to convince your team / client why it’s a great to use Kotlin.

event.title: Orange County Java User Group (OCJUG)
event.subject: Kotlin
event.speaker: Troy Miles
event.description:
Kotlin is a relatively new language on the Java Virtual Machine. JetBrains, the creators of IntelliJ IDEA, designed it to be a replacement for Java. Kotlin is also pragmatic; it recognizes the investment that your Java code and knowledge represent. So, it is 100% interoperable with Java. Not only can you call Java classes from Kotlin, but it is equally simple to call Kotlin from Java.

There are plenty of languages on the JVM. Unfortunately, most of them replace Java's complexity with their own. Kotlin does not, is modern, versatile, and streamlined. It offers many features to make you more productive. No more getters and setters. Classes are simpler to create and use. Most of Java's tedious boilerplate code is gone. And it relegates the dreaded null pointer exception to the history books with its type safety.

Not only is Kotlin open source and free to use, switching to it is simple. You can add it to your existing Java project. The following IDEs have Kotlin plugins: Eclipse, NetBeans, and of course, IntelliJ IDEA.

Apple garnered a lot of attention with the release of Swift in 2014. Developers praised its simplicity and beauty when compared to Objective-C, a language created in the 1980's. Kotlin is Swift for the JVM. It makes programming Java, a language born in 1995, fun again.

In this talk, we'll take a quick look at Kotlin. We will check out some of its coolest features, see how easy it is to add it to an existing Java project and finally look how beautiful it makes Android develop. It will be a fast and fun 90 minutes.

event.title: JUG - CS
event.subject: Kotlin: getting rid of Java
event.speaker: Héctor Valls
event.description:
Retomamos los encuentros mensuales del grupo y para inaugurar 2017 tenemos la charla "Kotlin: getting rid of Java" a cargo de Héctor Valls, ingeniero de software en ADC y desarrollador, entre otros, de proyectos para dispositivos móviles. Héctor nos presentará una introducción a este lenguaje de programación que está ganando peso en el desarrollo de aplicaciones Android comparándolo especialmente con Java.

Como siempre, al finalizar podremos continuar la conversación tomando unas cervezas.

event.title: New York Kotlin Meetup
event.subject: Anko
event.speaker: Kevin Most
event.description: We'll take a deep dive into Anko, a Kotlin library maintained by JetBrains and designed to make Android development expressive and fast. We'll cover the View DSL, the most well-known part of Anko, which allows clean programmatic creation of views without XML, but will also dive into the rest of this surprisingly comprehensive library, which includes type-safe wrappers for many of the low-level Android APIs, and extension methods for the support libraries to make them feel like a first-class part of the Android ecosystem.

event.speaker: Markus Winand
event.title: Java User Group Graz
event.subject: Modern SQL
event.description:
Die Datenbanksprache SQL hat sich in den letzten Jahrzehnten erheblich weiterentwickelt. Leider hat sich diese Weiterentwicklung weder in der einschlägigen Literatur noch im Kursangebot niedergeschlagen. Die Folge: Viele Entwickler verwenden SQL wie vor 20 Jahren.

Dieser Vortrag zeigt Anwendungsbeispiele der wichtigsten Neuerungen und stellt sie den “alten” Lösungsansätzen von SQL-92 gegenüber. Dadurch wird deutlich, dass zahlreiche Probleme mit modernem SQL sehr einfach und elegant gelöst werden können.

Kotlin, le langage de programmation développé par JetBrains s'est vu très rapidement adopté par la communauté Android et est facile à prendre en main pour les développeurs Java, Scala et Swift.

Louis Cognault viendra nous présenter le language et son utilisation concrète dans quelques projets, puis fera un petit retour d'expérience.

event.speaker: Juan Liska
event.title: Guatemala Kotlin Meetup
event.subject: Introducción a Programación Funcional en Kotlin
event.description:
Kotlin es un lenguaje relativamente nuevo que compila a Javascript y a bytecode del JVM. Fue diseñado por Jetbrains y ha crecido mucho en popularidad desde que se lanzó la versión 1.0 hace un año. Se usa sobre todo para hacer apps de Android porque es compatible con Java SE 6 pero tiene una sintaxis muy agradable. Se siente como python pero con excelente "type safety" y rendimiento.

Estaremos repasando las características básicas de Kotlin y de la programación funcional en Kotlin. Si el tiempo permite, habrá una demostración de async/await que será parte de kotlin1.1

event.speaker: Alexander Frank, Benedict Pregler
event.title: MobileTech Conference
event.subject: Kotlin Deep Dive – ein Vergleich des generierten Bytecodes zwischen Kotlin und Java
event.description: Die JVM-Sprache Kotlin wurde bereits in mehreren Betrachtungen mit ihren Vor- und Nachteilen im Bereich der Quellcode Erstellung vorgestellt. Aber wie sieht es eigentlich mit dem erzeugten Bytecode und dessen Performance aus? Ist der resultierende Bytecode äquivalent zu Java, gibt es Einbußen oder ist das Ergebnis möglicherweise sogar schneller? Wir vergleichen den kompilierten Bytecode gleicher Funktionalität und verwendeter Techniken (z.B. Lambdas, Streams usw.) in Java und Kotlin, um zu betrachten, wie die Verwendung von Kotlin den Bytecode und damit die Laufzeitperformance beeinflusst. Zusätzlich zur Betrachtung mit Standard-Java werfen wir einen Blick auf Android mit der neuen Kompilierungskette „Jack and Jill“ und deren Auswirkungen auf die Verwendung von Kotlin.
